9119205:
bronchoscopy note - [REDACTED]

pt [REDACTED] mrn [REDACTED] is a 80yo female here for bronch w EBUS staging and robotic biopsy of a 29.8mm LUL nodule that was ground-glass on CT, bronchus sign was negative, PET showed SUV 13.7.

under general we did linear EBUS first using the Pentax EB-1990i scope with 21g needle and sampled stations 10R x4, 10L x3, 2L x3, ROSE was there and showed Malignant - NSCLC NOS at multiple stations.

then switched to Ion robot and navigated to the LUL anterior (B3) lesion, registration was 1.8mm which is fine, got radial EBUS showing adjacent view and did tool in lesion confirmation with cbct. took 8 forceps bx, 2 needle passes, brushings x2, BAL sent for cultures.

ROSE from the nodule was Malignant - adenocarcinoma.

no bleeding no ptx   patient did well

specimens to path for cyto, surgical path, cell block, flow, molecular if needed

d/c home after recovery with standard precautions, f/u 1-2wks for path

Katherine Lee md
ip attending
